author: m.kalinin
content: in this approach a proposer should make the last aggregation step by concatenating aggregates received from different subnets. it can be a p2p constraint that an aggregate in the attestation_aggregates topic must contain signatures of only one committee. i don't see this approach increasing dos surface anyhow

author: m.kalinin
content: I am in support of that as I have been independently thinking on a solution to pack aggregates more tightly. It can increase block capacity in a way that 8 slots of good aggregates can be accommodated instead of 2 as of today without increasing its size in bytes (this is with 900k validators -- the number of slots accommodated with no size increase will be lower with bigger validator set)
